page.title: 05A PART OF VILLAGE HISTORY.
page.content: Mr Sargeant has lived in Leasingham for{thirty years}and is regarded as a native villager.He was born in Lincoln but moved in 1901 when his father bought a smallholding.He later farmed in North Nottinghamshire and in{1951 {bought Hall Farm in Leasingham.}The farm extended over most of the west side of the village covering much the land to the west of what was then the main A15 road through Leasingham. Mr Sargeant was deeply involved in the development of the village as the population increased.He was a{member of the{village hall commitee,}and devoted a lot of time to raising money for the building of the{new village {hall}and for the{village playing {field.The Crescent,}designed by an architect whom Mr Sargeant engaged,was the first part of the village to be developed.
